units.title: Tissue cleaning and crypt isolation
units.text: To clean the tissue and isolate fresh crypts colon tissue was ﬁrst sliced open lengthwise and wiped 3–4 times with gauze (Fisher Scientiﬁc) to remove waste and mucus. The tissue was then cut into small sections of ~2” × 2” and placed into a 15 cm dish ﬁlled with PBS++ (PBS supplemented with 10 mM HEPES (Thermo Fisher Scientiﬁc), 1X GlutaMAX (Thermo Fisher Scientiﬁc), 1X Pen‑Strep (Thermo Fisher Scientiﬁc), and 2.5 μg/mL Amphotericin B (Thermo Fisher Scientiﬁc)). The epithelium was then minced from tissue segments using scalpels (Fisher Scientiﬁc) and collected into 50 mL conical tubes. Minced epithelium was washed 3 times with DMEM++ (Advanced DMEM/F12 (Thermo Fisher Scientiﬁc) supplemented with 10 mM HEPES, 1X GlutaMAX, 1X Pen‑Strep, and 2.5 μg/mL Amphotericin B), and centrifuged at 500 × g for 3 min at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Describes the initial steps to obtain crypts from human colon tissue.

units.title: EDTA digestion to release crypts
units.text: After the ﬁnal wash, tissue was resuspended in 25 mL of 2.5 mM EDTA in PBS and placed in an end‑over‑rotator at 37 °C until crypts were visible, around 12 min.
units.rationale: Specifies the enzymatic digestion step that liberates crypt structures.

units.title: Organoid growth media formulation
units.text: Crypts were fed with organoid growth media: Advanced DMEM/F12 supplemented with 1X Pen‑Strep, 10 mM HEPES, 1X GlutaMAX, 1X B‑27 Supplement (Thermo Fisher Scientiﬁc), 0.2 nM Wnt Surrogate protein, 5 nM Gastrin‑1 (Tocris), 1.25 mM N‑Acetyl‑L‑Cysteine (Sigma‑Aldrich), 10 mM Nicotinamide (Sigma‑Aldrich), 100 µg/mL Primocin (InvivoGen), 500 nM A 83‑01 (Tocris), 50 ng/mL recombinant human EGF (R&D Systems), 100 ng/mL recombinant human Noggin (R&D Systems), 250 ng/mL recombinant human R‑spondin 3 (Roche), 100 ng/mL recombinant human IGF1 (BioLegend), 50 ng/mL recombinant human FGF2 (PeproTech), and 10 µM Y‑27632.
units.rationale: Provides the complete composition of the medium used to culture organoids.

units.title: Irradiation and DSS injury treatments
units.text: For irradiation studies, the plates were placed on the centre of the rotating table of the (137Cs) gamma irradiator) for the time periods equivalent to either 6 Gy or 12 Gy, and then the organoids were further cultured in the incubator. For DSS treatment, DSS (MP Biomedicals) was dissolved in organoid media (without EGF or Nicotinamide), and added to organoid wells overnight for 16 h, after which organoids were washed twice with Advanced DMEM/F12 and then replaced with organoid media.
units.rationale: Details two distinct injury paradigms applied to organoid cultures.

units.title: Cytomix cytokine injury treatment
units.text: For cytomix treatment, human recombinant TNFα (R&D Systems), IFNγ (R&D systems), and IL‑1β (PeproTech) were dissolved in organoid media and added to the organoid wells overnight for 16 h, after which organoids were washed twice with Advanced DMEM/F12 and then replaced with organoid media.
units.rationale: Describes the cytokine cocktail used to simulate inflammatory injury.

units.title: FITC‑dextran permeability assay
units.text: FITC‑dextran (MedChemExpress) diluted to 2 mg/mL in PBS for 5 min in the incubator (37 °C, 5% CO2) for 30 min, after which organoids were incubated in a solution of 4 kDa FITC‑Dextran in 30 µL droplets in 6‑well plates. The plates were placed upside down in the incubator (37 °C, 5% CO2) for 30 min, after which organoids were imaged on a Nikon spinning disc confocal to collect fluorescence and DIC images, and the percentage of intact organoids was calculated as the number of organoids per condition/donor that excluded FITC‑dextran from the lumen divided by the total number of organoids.
units.rationale: Outlines the procedure to assess barrier integrity of organoids.

units.title: Caspase‑3/7 apoptosis assay
units.text: Organoids were incubated in CellEvent Caspase‑3/7 Detection Reagent (Thermo Fisher) diluted in media according to manufacturer protocols for 30 min, washed with PBS, and imaged on a Nikon spinning disc confocal to collect fluorescence and DIC images. The % area of caspase‑3/7 positive staining was quantified using FIJI as the area of organoid stained positive for Caspase‑3/7 divided by the total area of the organoid from DIC images.
units.rationale: Provides a quantitative method to measure apoptosis in organoids.

units.title: Organoid passaging protocol
units.text: For passaging, organoids were mechanically dislodged from Cultrex domes using a P1000 pipette tip and resuspended in cold 10 mM EDTA with 10 µM Y‑27632 (STEMCELL Technologies) in a 15 mL conical tube. The tube containing organoids was then placed on an end‑over‑end rotator at 4 °C for 30 min and then centrifuged for 5 min at 500 × g, 4 °C. Organoids were then resuspended in 1X Trypsin (Thermo Fisher Scientific) and placed in an end‑over‑end rotator for 6 min at 37 °C. Following dissociation, Trypsin was neutralized with DMEM containing 10% FBS, and organoids were centrifuged for 5 min at 500 × g, 4 °C.
units.rationale: Describes how organoids are dissociated and replated for continued culture.

units.title: Single‑cell dissociation for scRNA‑seq
units.text: For scRNA‑seq experiments, organoids were dissociated using the Neural Dissociation‑P kit (Miltenyi). Organoids were pipetted out of their microwell plates and into a deep‑well 96‑well plate (Thermo Fisher) for dissociation. Enzyme mix 1 was prepared according to manufacturer protocols with the addition of Y‑27632 for a final volume containing human recombinant proteins, and organoids were placed at 10 °C for 10 min, after which enzyme mix 2 was added. Organoids were kept at 10 °C throughout dissociation for up to 60 min, and were removed every 10 min to be pipette mixed with a P1000 pipette to aid in disassociation. Once dissociation was complete, organoids were centrifuged for 3 min, 500 × g, 4 °C and washed twice with PBS.
units.rationale: Details the enzymatic workflow to obtain single cells for sequencing.

units.title: Cell hashing for multiplexed scRNA‑seq
units.text: For experiments involving hashing, cells were demultiplexed using the HTODemux function in Seurat. Organoids were resuspended in 100 µL cell staining buffer (2% BSA, 0.01% Tween in PBS) and 1 µL of a unique cell hashing antibody (TotalSeqA: BioLegend) was added per condition for 20 min on ice, then cells were pipette mixed 60 times. Organoids were then washed three times with PBS and resuspended in organoid wash buffer (0.1% Triton X‑100, 0.2% BSA) overnight at 4 °C on a rocker.
units.rationale: Provides the protocol for labeling cells with barcoded antibodies for multiplexing.
